item.title: Consumers Have No Access To Pound Sterling Due To Foreign Exchange Shortage
item.description:
Consumers Have No Access To Pound Sterling Due To Foreign Exchange Shortage

One of the more worrisome side effects of the Brexit is how consumers are struggling to buy Pounds Sterling. After the price had dropped to its lowest point over 30 years, a lot of people started buying up Pounds en masse. Foreign currency providers are feeling the effects, as they have no stock to meet customer demand.

item.title: Ardor - New Competitor to Ethereum Arises Amidst Reports of The DAO Attack
item.description:
Ardor - New Competitor to Ethereum Arises Amidst Reports of The DAO Attack

Ardor, a "child chain" platform developed by the Nxt core dev team, is announced. The news comes amidst reports of The DAO hack. The event, which led to up 50 million Ether being lost to attackers, has had a very negative impact on Ethereum - the most popular Blockchain-as-a-Service platform so far.

item.title: Selfrando Technique Makes Tor Nearly Invulnerable To De-anonymization Attacks
item.description:
Selfrando Technique Makes Tor Nearly Invulnerable To De-anonymization Attacks

For quite some time now, there have been concerns over how the FBI managed to unmask Tor users. Given the nature of this anonymity software, it should not be possible for law enforcement to reveal somebody's real IP address. Selfrando, a new technique developed by academics and researchers, should prevent this from happening in the future.

item.title: Can the blockchain make electronic voting more secure?
item.description:
Can the blockchain make electronic voting more secure?

Answer: I imagine it could. That is one of the possible applications repeatedly proposed for the future by many of the Blockchain experts whose articles I've read. Even now you can embed 40 bytes of info on to a single bitcoin transaction. I imagine that would be enough for a single voter to use ...

item.title: Why is Bitcoin surging since Britain voted to leave the EU?
item.description:
Why is Bitcoin surging since Britain voted to leave the EU?

Answer (1 of 3): Upon Brexit, there has been an expected flock to safety and safe haven assets. You see this across many traditional vents, including gold, yen, US dollar, etc today. What most people don't realize is that Bitcoin exhibits the same qualities as many of these other traditional safe...

item.title: Bitcoin price rise again thanks to the Brexit | HolyTransaction
item.description:
Bitcoin price rise again thanks to the Brexit | HolyTransaction

After reaching a low of $550 during the week, the bitcoin price rose again reaching a high of $650 today. Although it was normal to see a correction after the fast climb of the previous weeks, the bitcoin price probably fell also because of the " Bremain ", or the possibility of UK to remain into the EU.

item.title: 31 Chinese Firms Form Financial Blockchain Consortium - CoinDesk
item.description:
31 Chinese Firms Form Financial Blockchain Consortium - CoinDesk

Chinese financial services firm Ping An Bank and a subsidiary of QQ instant message app maker Tencent are among more than 30 technology and financial firms in China that have formed a new consortium dedicated to blockchain tech.
